content: hello everyone why lock here thanks for
joining me today we continue our studies in chaos themes scatter terrain I'm
gonna make an Eldridge portal with these teeth looking things fits in a Cthulhu
campaign Dungeons & Dragons or hammer 40k a lot of uses so let's go to the
table and start building infinite thanks to my patreon patrons and remember that
our sponsor is heroes hoard for you 3d printers out there excellent selection
including Altru tiles lines I'm gonna start this on double corrugated
cardboard although single corrugated or even foam
board would be fine just cut out a rough oval shape and then to hide that subtle
Ridge texture I trace this onto some food box cardstock and glued that on a
smooth surface now then I mixed up some sculpting mold you could also use air
dry clay or drywall mud or whatever your modeling paste of choice is doesn't
matter just cover up the edges and kind of build a rounded slope for the whole
perimeter so while that's curing plastic forks I chopped off the tines and then
stuck them in some cardboard to go out to the garage for some primer two thin
coats applied from 12 inches away and let it cure overnight that done I took
this necrotic flesh color and airbrushed them up and then with white in the
airbrush sort of frosted the tips give a nice gradient back to the base
solid black on that smooth area just cheap acrylic craft paint for economics
and there was some white paint on a toothbrush I flicked a star field into
existence then magenta into the airbrush Vallejo
paints airbrush quite nicely just some blobs and tendrils like a nebula
followed up by pink again random blobs and tendrils some overlapping with the
magenta and some not and finally another flick of white for more stars in the
foreground instant nebula by the way if you find my videos helpful feel free to
like subscribe reminder Bell blah blah blah so for the teeth I chop them to
various lengths and hot-glued them around the perimeter at various angles
for a chaotic look put a little more sculpting mould over the top just barely
enough to bury the base of the teeth and I want this to match the ground of the
hell sphere I did recently in episode 139 since this also be part of my chaos
scatter terrain collection so first a solid white coat of white PVA glue and a
light sprinkling of construction sand not full coverage something like half
few hours later with that totally dry base coated with burnt umber and this is
back to cheap acrylic craft paints plaid makes several great brands including
Apple Barrel after that a heavy wash with black this
is like one part paint to ten parts water and just slather it all over there
and finish it off with a dry brush of tan
and light gray so here it is in context with a couple of chaos models these are
actually from a recent eBay lot that I stripped and have been repainting
getting ready for some battle reports notice that I did kind of strangely
paint pieces along the way and that's just because getting underneath the
teeth was gonna be difficult so I wanted to get that airbrushing done beforehand
think I might make a few of these column dangerous terrain and you'll be able to
see this piece in action pretty soon in a new battle report on my other youtube
channel why lock plays nebula trick never gets old I got to thank commissar
Kamsa on YouTube for that and again if you don't want to use sculpt AMOLED
air-dry clay woodwork drywall mud whatever you use to normally fill out
your terrain again great brands use here Shahbandar for my glue gun plaid and
Vallejo paints anyways fun little project if you have
other ideas for Kaos base terrain please leave a comment below with a suggestion
if you like this particular project here's two more you might want to check
out also enjoy this community showcase I'm wild Locke thanks for joining and
I'll see you next time
